# tricobbler

The word `tricobbler` comes from a Chinese proverb emphasizing that
collaboration among ordinary people can surpass the intelligence of a
single genius.

> Three cobblers with their wits combined equal Zhuge Liang
>
> 三个臭皮匠，顶个诸葛亮

The goal of `tricobbler` is to combine a

## Installation

You can install the development version of tricobbler like so:

``` r
# FILL THIS IN! HOW CAN PEOPLE INSTALL YOUR DEV PACKAGE?
```

## Example

This is a basic example which shows you how to solve a common problem:

``` r
library(tricobbler)
## basic example code
```

# Package index

## All functions

- [`BaseAgent`](http://dipterix.org/tricobbler/reference/BaseAgent.md) :

  `TriCobbler` Base Agent Class

- [`Contract()`](http://dipterix.org/tricobbler/reference/Contract.md) :
  Contract

- [`ContractExecutor()`](http://dipterix.org/tricobbler/reference/ContractExecutor.md)
  : ContractExecutor

- [`Manifest()`](http://dipterix.org/tricobbler/reference/Manifest.md) :
  Validated Container Linking Master Policy to State Policies

- [`MasterPolicy()`](http://dipterix.org/tricobbler/reference/MasterPolicy.md)
  : Master Workflow Policy Defining Stages and Version

- [`OutputSchema()`](http://dipterix.org/tricobbler/reference/OutputSchema.md)
  : OutputSchema

- [`OutputValidator()`](http://dipterix.org/tricobbler/reference/OutputValidator.md)
  : OutputValidator

- [`StageContract()`](http://dipterix.org/tricobbler/reference/StageContract.md)
  : StageContract

- [`StatePolicy()`](http://dipterix.org/tricobbler/reference/StatePolicy.md)
  : State-Level Policy Implementation for Workflow Stages

- [`manifest_write()`](http://dipterix.org/tricobbler/reference/manifest-file.md)
  [`manifest_read()`](http://dipterix.org/tricobbler/reference/manifest-file.md)
  : Read or Write Manifest from or to a YAML File
